summary: Ricardo Morales is mentioned in the context of anti-Castro activities and investigations into the assassination of Orlando Letelier. He appears in files related to anti-Castro activists, alongside individuals like Orlando Bosch, Joaquin Godoy, and others. The documents suggest Morales was involved in activities that drew the attention of the CIA and FBI. While the documents do not explicitly link Morales to the JFK assassination, they place him within a network of individuals and groups involved in potentially illegal activities, including bombings and connections to Cuban exile groups. The documents span from 1968 to 1978, indicating a sustained period of involvement in these activities.
